title: TBWA\Chiat\Day Appoints Andrew Dauska as Managing Director on Nissan Business
text:
LOS ANGELES, Oct. 7, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- TBWAChiatDay has appointed Andrew Dauska as Managing Director of the agency's Nissan account, reporting directly to TBWAChiatDay LA President, Luis DeAnda.
Andrew, who joins TBWA from Wunderman in Minneapolis, has a proven track record of excellence in developing and leading highly successful brand and business strategies for a wide range of brands including Subaru, Delta, Porsche, BestBuy and Allstate. In his new role he will oversee the Nissan business, one of TBWAChiatDay's largest roster clients. 
DeAnda commented: "Andrew brings with him a wealth of strategic management experience and creative know-how across several key categories, not the least of which is automotive. He is also a veteran when it comes to building and leading large cross-functional agency teams. He will be a great asset for us and for Nissan, and we are thrilled to have him." 
As SVP, Client Services Director at Wunderman, Andrew led the 120+ person office and its charter client, BestBuy, working across several client business groups servicing both digital and owned channels. Prior to Wunderman, he was Group Director, Brand Strategy and Integration at Barrie D'Rozario DiLorenzo (bd'd) where he developed go-to-market strategies for Dell and Wagner Spraytech.
Andrew also spent nearly 8 years with Carmichael-Lynch, where he was Group Account Director and, later, Senior Partner, Director of Account Management. Andrew was a principal architect of the much-admired "Love" campaign for Subaru of America, and also advised brand teams on major strategic initiatives and creative development projects for clients including Jack Link's Snacks, CITGO, Kellogg School of Management, Rubbermaid, Graco and Calphalon.
Andrew began his career in Account Management at Campbell-Mithun in Minneapolis, and spent several years at Leo Burnett in Chicago.
"It's an honor and a pleasure to join this iconic agency alongside such a talented group of people," said Dauska. "I look forward to putting my experience to work for Nissan and to furthering TBWA's vision for the brand." 
About TBWAChiatDay LA:
